title: Typography
intro: Available typography styles with their semantic meaning and usage examples.

styles.class-description:
Area-name is used to identify groups where the semantic value is not part of the page content.

It can be used to identify different environments such as Premium/Admin areas, or to group content that is not part of defined hierarchy, such as Indoor/Outdoor, Rent/Buy, Premiere League/Champions League.

The area-name should be short and ideally single line. It can also have an area-subtitle for support. If necessary an area-description is available to be used, it can have any length and format from single word to multi-line text, including style modifiers such and bold and italic.

Area Name

With area-subtitle

Area Name

styles.class-description:
Page title is used to style the current page title.

Usually the H1 tag, however it can be used in certain components such as featured content slideshows. It can take different size variants and have a subtitle.

styles.class-description:
Section header is used to style the secondary headings in the page.

Usually the H2 tag, however it can be used in certain components with a different tag. It can also have a sub-header.

styles.class-description:
Used to identify content categories.

Content category is usualy the primary type of content classification.

A category can have sub-categories.

styles.class-description:
Used to identify content tags.

Content tags is usualy a secondary type of classification, mainly used to create granular content relations.

All tags have the same hierarchy level.

styles.class-description:
List is used to identify unordered lists. Items on this lists don't have any particular order and can be shuffled without affecting the context.

For example: list of ingredients, available colors, models, etc.
